FuncDef:
The qos phb enable vxlan-mode command maps internal priorities of packets entering the VXLAN tunnel to VXLAN DSCP values based on a specific DS PHB table.
The undo qos phb enable vxlan-mode command disables the mapping from internal priorities of packets entering the VXLAN tunnel to VXLAN DSCP values based on a specific DS PHB table.
By default, the VXLAN DSCP value of a packet is the same as its DSCP value.
ParentView: VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a DS domain.
The value is a string of 1 to 48 case-sensitive characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When packets enter a VXLAN tunnel, to maintain the same QoS priorities for packets transmitted on different networks, run the qos phb enable vxlan-mode command. After the qos phb enable vxlan-mode command is run, the system maps internal priorities of packets to VXLAN DSCP values based on a specific DS PHB table.
Prerequisites
The DS domain and VXLAN have been configured.
